text: We're now going to move on to the section of control variables.

One will be control variables that show strength and the other that shows weakness.

The second control variable is the closing price on the day.
So again, if we close at the absolute extreme, whether it's the top or the bottom, that's
showing us an identifier of strength that's being shown by either the buyers or the sellers.
Then the location of the value area as well as the shape of the value area, so if we have
a value area that's situated towards the top end or the bottom end of the day, again that's
showing us that there's high likelihood for at least a continuation, whether it's
a drift or a trend, at least some form of a continuation or movement in the direction

we tend to show us probably a lot more one directional type trade, whereas when we have
narrow small little value areas, again that's showing us a little bit more muted balanced
type trade.
And then range, expansion and volume, like we said, you know, when we have the expansion
